[Think Stats Chapter 8 Exercise 2](http://greenteapress.com/thinkstats2/html/thinkstats2009.html#toc77) (scoring)

>> ``` python 
>> samp_dist = [np.mean(np.random.exponential(2,10)) for x in range(0,1000)]
>> plt.hist(samp_dist)
>> plt.xlabel('Point estimates')
>> plt.ylabel('Freqency')
>> plt.show()
>> ```
>>
>> ![img](data:image/png;base64,)
>>
>> ``` python
>> Est = np.mean(samp_dist)
>> SE = scipy.stats.sem(samp_dist)
>> print('Estimate (L):',Est)
>> print('Standard Error:',SE)
>> print('Confidence Interval:',scipy.stats.norm.interval(0.9,Est,SE))
>> ```
>>
>> ```python
>> Estimate (L): 2.02068097054
>> Standard Error: 0.0207318708649
>> Confidence Interval: (1.9865800775585971, 2.054781863529854)
>> ```
>>
>> Note: I used the normal distribution to calculate the confidence interval because the sample size was large enough.
